recipes.label: TEST
recipes.startdescription: Gonna make splinters

recipes.label: Potential, Realized
recipes.startdescription: My ally has gathered some experience. I could speak to them about what they've learnt. [This will increase your Ally's aspects by one.]
recipes.description: @#friend.eva|Eva's fingers curl into fists. Her eyes are emptier.#friend.vanja|Little Vanja shivers. 'Sometimes I think they will come back. Sometimes.'#friend.tibor|For a moment, Tibor smiles appreciatively through his pain. And then the moment is over.#friend.walther|'Light persists. I suppose.'#friend.daria|'A little more dangerous, now.'#friend.padre|'One who has faith will find his strength renewed, no matter how many times he falls.'#friend.lorenzo|'Buono - better and better.'#friend.fiorenza|'Ancora, ancora.'#friend.yuri|'This is a good thing. I have no doubts. I have never had any doubts.'#friend.iosef|'An improvement? I would consider returning to the gulag an improvement.'#friend.konstantin|'And the pieces fit together like so. Now, if you'll excuse me - I must wash my hands.'#friend.nikolai|'Da.'@

recipes.label: An Ally?
recipes.startdescription: @#friend.daria.local|Daria is napping beneath a pine tree with a knife in her hand. 'Find your own shade,' she calls out as I approach. 'This tree's mine.' When she hears me approaching still, she spares me an annoyed glare; the glare changes to intrigue when she sees it is me. 'Oh. The others have been talking about you. Capitan. I've actually wanted to speak with you, you know...'#friend.padre.local|The priest is at the graves: grim rows of wrapped bodies, each corpse with a crucifix posted by its head. 'Twice in a forty years Europe has gone to war. Mannaggia - such a waste of youth, to send boys to die.' He straightens one of the crosses and looks at me. 'Sometimes war is necessary. But this never is.'#friend.fiorenza.local|A sprinting Fiorenza crashes into me, tumbling down as if she'd hit a brick wall. I'm impressed when she springs again to her feet, apparently unfazed. 'You - I need your help,' she pants, slinging her rifle back over her shoulder. 'If you care anything about innocent lives, you'll listen to me.'#friend.lorenzo.local|Lorenzo is washing his instruments when I find him: surgeon's tools on his right; pots and pans on his left. 'Ah! Your arrival is most welcome,' he says when he notices me. 'Our little cell of fighters would be grateful for any help a seasoned partisan captain like yourself could offer. And we do have a... problem.'#friend.orsolina|'War, again. It has been a long time since I went to war,' Orsolina says. 'But I suppose even a housecat can remember something of being a lion. Molto viene preso, ma molto rimane. He made my kind to last, even when we don't.'#friend.giorgiou|Giorgiou tells me he has been working with a group of disgruntled mafiosi, who have been run thin by Mussolini's crackdowns. Their new business enterprise involves moving things for the resistance: supplies, weapons, artefacts. People, sometimes. 'But a burglar has been at our latest stock of exports,' he explains. 'This, I could use your help with.'#friend.zulfiya|Zulfiya eluded a few of our patrols earlier today. Now, by night, she appears directly before me, and I decide to humour her. My friend told me she can be a good ally to have. It's not much of a conversation, though. 'Voronezh. Black city. It was always dark here, before. Would you like to see? It's very beautiful, I promise.' I hope she's getting at something, and not only babbling.#friend.chaima|Lalla Chaima, the Huntress, receives me with silent respect. When she learns I am a friend of the one called Exile, she finally starts entertaining a conversation with me. 'So that's what they've put you up to? You seem a bit short of being Named,' Chaima says flatly. 'But if they thought you were capable of it, perhaps I am wrong.'#friend.yuri.local|Last I saw Yuri, he was a bright-eyed cadet who read too much Marx. The years have not diminished his fanaticism for Party ideology. 'A pleasure to see you again,' he says, saluting. 'The dialectic moves all things, doesn't it?' He always did talk that way. Figuratives.#friend.iosef.local|Iosef I knew from my youth. Seeing him now - I an officer, and he a convict pressed into service - I cannot say I was wholly unmoved. When we speak, his voice is a conspiratorial whisper: 'You've not forgotten your old friend, I hope. He's in great need of a favour.'#friend.konstantin.local|I have heard the doctor's name before, during the Terror. A 'physician' for the NKVD - I knew the NKVD, and they have no need for physicians. Dr. Ismailov, then, is more of a torturer than a surgeon. But perhaps I can find utility in that.#friend.nikolai.local|I have seen, here and there, Nikolai burn offerings to the Forge before operating his mortar. Today, I find him alone in the armoury, puzzling over a case of melted, misshapen rifles. He registers my presence with a grunt, then goes back to his examinations.@
recipes.description: @#friend.daria.local|'Back in the day, I was wanted. And I don't mean in the nice way.' Daria has been in many places doing many things. Lots of them illegal. She tosses her knife from one hand to the other as she speaks: 'Luckily, a war is a nice smokescreen for things. Records get lost, criminal archives go up in flames... I want to expedite the loss of knowledge a little. Knowledge about me, specifically.'#friend.padre.local|The priest and I speak of our experiences during the Great War. Quietly, he begins to regard me with a kind of respect. 'I do not know if you keep the faith, but everyone deserves peace and passage once they depart from this world,' he says. 'War makes it hard for the dead to acquire either of these. Walk with me. I will show you what I mean.'#friend.fiorenza.local|Fiorenza pulls me over to a map of the city. She points: 'Cathedral Square. Families. Elderly. Friends from the orchestra. Trapped.' Her voice is taut with stress. 'Please - they will die if nobody comes.' And then the pain in her eyes resolves to steel, and the timbre of her voice steadies with determination. 'Help me save them.'#friend.lorenzo.local|'You've seen our numbers. Many of us are not soldiers, and I only have so much to work with here,' Lorenzo gestures to the barren stock of the field tent. 'The hospital has rooms and medicine we can salvage. But men we send to reclaim that building do not return.' He leans low, and whsipers what he says next. 'The more supertitious of us say that, beneath the building, is something foul. Un mostro.'#friend.orsolina|Orsolina explains her recent efforts here in Campobasso, liberating the city and its outskirts day-by-day. 'I was not born an Italian, but I suppose I have chosen to be one. And because I have, I would like to see my chosen country free.' She takes out a map - sewer tunnels? A route is traced in black ink. 'I have been digging this route beneath the fort for some time, now. Guarda qui...'#friend.giorgiou|A man who had seen the 'burglar' says he thought it was a man in a feathered cloak - then it took flight. 'Thieves taking from thieves,' Giorgiou sighs. 'And greed is at the heart of war, you know. Why, our mutual friend once stole an entire fortune all by himself...' He then begins to talk about the historical relationship between conquest and plunder, but fortunately at this point the gunfire resumes.#friend.zulfiya|Zulfiya insists that I go visit this 'night-place of blackest oak' at once. I tell her that there are no more forests around Voronezh, and she insists I try harder to see them. I tell her I don't understand what she means, and she insists that I let her ink on my skin so I may, at last, understand.#friend.chaima|'I am here on business. The weather here is very disappointing, but the Russians are paying me well to hunt here, and I like challenges.' She polishes the barrel of her rifle. 'Do you like challenges?'#friend.yuri.local|'It is my responsibility to ensure our comrades serve in accordance with the Founder's doctrines. Sniff out weakness. Ideological treason,' Yuri says. He then steps closer. 'So, this matter in which I am about to ask your assistance is a great shame for me. Reprimand me as you see fit - but remember that even the watchful man must sometimes blink.'#friend.iosef.local|'I don't belong with these degenerates, tovarisch. Every march of ours is a death march,' Iosef says. 'But I think you can get me out. You're a ranking man - our commanding officer will listen to you. If you get him a certain something. You'll do it, yes? For your old friend?'#friend.konstantin.local|Dr. Ismailov shakes my hand. 'I've heard of you as well. Formerly of the OPRP, yes? I used to think you were all lunatics, but I've been convinced otherwise in recent years,' he smiles. 'If your contingent needs a doctor, I would be most interested in working together. You will need to help me with a professional matter first, though. A matter of science.'#friend.nikolai.local|Nikolai explains to me - in as few words as possible - how the armoury has been victim to peculiar instances of vandalism. The armoury is like a church to him, I think. For someone - or something - to be profaning his church is impermissible. He and I strike a mutual bargain amongst the shells and rifle-racks: I will help him, and he will help me.@

recipes.label: Lorenzo wipes sweat from his forehead
recipes.startdescription: 'Is that trouble with the hospital sorted out yet? We need a place for the wounded and the hungry.'
recipes.description: Lorenzo manages a smile and nods curtly. 'We will see it done, I am sure. But I hope sooner rather than later.'

recipes.label: Fiorenza paces frantically across the room, and back
recipes.startdescription: 'They won't last long out there; not alone. They aren't fighters...'
recipes.description: Fiorenza digs her fingers into her hair, agitation twisting her features. 'What are we waiting for? Please - we have to help them!'

recipes.label: Padre Ruggiero stands solemnly at the threshold
recipes.startdescription: 'Well? Do the dead rest at last? Are we finished with our duties?'
recipes.description: The priest tuts disapprovingly. 'C'Ã¨ ancora del lavoro da fare.'

recipes.label: Daria whittles with a small, hooked knife
recipes.startdescription: 'A woman wants to vanish,' Daria murmurs. 'Do you still see me?'
recipes.description: 'Mm. Un peccato.'

recipes.label: Yuri's eyes are bright with anticipation
recipes.startdescription: 'I've not had any luck with our... vermin problem as of yet. How goes your search?'
recipes.description: Yuri's brow creases, and he chews the inside of his mouth. 'No matter. This is merely another trial. Only another trial.'

recipes.label: Iosef shivers miserably in the cold
recipes.startdescription: 'Have you gotten him off my back yet?'
recipes.description: Iosef wants to curse, but his chattering teeth do not allow him. He does, however, manage to frown.

recipes.label: Dr. Ismailov wrings his hands excitedly, smiling
recipes.startdescription: 'Have you made any headway on that matter I'd mentioned?'
recipes.description: The doctor's smile wilts like a dying flower. 'Oh. I see.'

recipes.label: Nikolai waits, expressionless
recipes.startdescription: As per usual, Nikolai isn't saying anything.
recipes.description: Nikolai continues not saying anything.

recipes.label: A Friend in Need
recipes.startdescription: @#friend.daria.local|Daria spends some time reading through the folder. She snorts at some parts; she laughs at others. Then, she lights a match and lets fire curl across the paperwork. Red flowers bloom on yellow parchment. 'Presto!' she exclaims, tossing the ash to the wind. 'I am vanished.'#friend.padre.local|'Receive them well, Lord. May they pass on in peace, relieved of battle,' The priest finishes his prayer. We turn again to look at the blasted streets of Napoli. 'This is the part they don't sing about in the songs,' he intones. 'Death follows glory. Let every man who thinks himself a lion keep that lesson in his heart.' I look at him. 'And never forget the dead - they won't forget you.'#friend.fiorenza.local|Fiorenza speaks to each and every soul rescued from the entrapment at Cathedral Square. Embraces and tears; blessings and more blessings. Fiorenza embraces me also, though her arms do not reach all the way around my body. 'Grazie, grazie mille. You are a hero.' Then she composes herself, and gives me as good of a salute a student might manage. It is a very good show of honor, I think.#friend.lorenzo.local|Wounded and hungry partisans sigh relief as they are shown to beds and kitchens still intact. Lorenzo has only a moment to spare before he is back again with the others, moving crates of supplies into the newly reclaimed hospital. But he says thank you; he says that he and his people will follow me.#friend.yuri.local|Yuri considers our new prisoner with great displeasure. He flexes his hand, clenching it into a fist and then unclenching it. 'You've done me a great service. I will not forget it - nor will I ever be so careless again.'#friend.iosef.local|The officer of the penal battalion agrees to part with Iosef in exchange for the film. 'Not a fair trade for you,' the officer snickers, 'but if you want him so bad, take him.' Iosef frowns.#friend.konstantin.local|The doctor holds the vial up to the sunlight. 'Uncompromised. Excellent.' He places the sample into a small steel box, and the box into his doctor's bag. 'War's such a robust proving ground for science. I cannot wait to see what we shall learn next.'#friend.nikolai.local|Nikolai builds a small fire pit outside, then scatters the ashes through the flames. He nods at me.@
recipes.description:
I clasp hands with my comrade.

[This Ally will now follow you out of the Current Warzone.]

recipes.label: Heal my Wound?
recipes.startdescription: If I have Provisions, I can have the medics treat my injuries before they become serious. Wait too long, and they may need to amputate something.

recipes.label: Heal my Wound
recipes.startdescription: This will do.
recipes.description: Time passes in the medic's tent, and then I am returned to the field.

recipes.label: Consult with scouts?
recipes.startdescription: Our scouts can comb the battlefield in quick order; quicker than anyone else might. I could also use them to find some advantage in otherwise disruptive weather or natural circumstance.

recipes.label: Consult with field medics?
recipes.startdescription: Our medics and doctors are here to keep us in fighting condition - or at least in some state close to that. I can ask them to tend our wounded, or to see to my own injuries.

recipes.label: Consult with engineers?
recipes.startdescription: Our engineers can see to an array of vital tasks. If I give them Provisions, they can build new lodgings for the men; if I give them destroyed Infrastructure or damaged machinery, they can restore it if provided with the Provisions to see the work done.

recipes.label: Consult with infantrymen?
recipes.startdescription: The face and foremost arm of our contingent. I can send them into town to offer the locals relief, or to strongarm those same locals into being useful.

recipes.label: Consult with volunteer militia?
recipes.startdescription: Not soldiers, but fighters all the same, and high in spirit. I can send them into town to offer the locals relief, or to strongarm those same locals into being useful.

recipes.label: Consult with an adept of the solemn arts?
recipes.startdescription: If someone has fallen, this one can make them stand again - if only for a short time.

recipes.label: Consult with an adept of the Glorious arts?
recipes.startdescription: This individual knows how to purge impurities from the world, and how also to derive power from doing so.

recipes.label: Consult with an adept of the red arts?
recipes.startdescription: The Red Grail gives life and takes life. I can manage the latter myself, and so my prisoner will handle the former part.

recipes.label: Call upon the Cartographer of Scars to raise a corpse to half-life
recipes.startdescription: The guard I have posted watches my prisoner carefully as they raise a hammer above the body of the deceased. The room chills a shade colder.
recipes.description: The corpse lurches to its feet, each jagged movement punctuated by a sound like the crunching of broken glass. It will fight until it is struck down, or until its time in our world runs out.

recipes.label: Call upon the Watchman to scour an impurity from the world
recipes.startdescription: My prisoner must find the sun at dawn to perform their work, and so in the dim, early hours we drag them from their cell out into the snow. As we await the sun, I keep my hand on my service revolver.
recipes.description: When the first rays of sun vault over the horizon, my prisoner holds their hands out to the sky. A force moves through the air. For a second, my vision is speckled with phantom stars. Then they stand, and inform me their work is done.

recipes.label: Call upon the Red Grail to enrich the blood and the flesh?
recipes.startdescription:
Even with the arts of Grail at my disposal, I'll need a bit more to fully address these wounds. An engineer's tools will be necessary to work on this uncommon biology.

[Provide Ally Engineers to complete the healing of this Ally.]
recipes.description: I could not muster the material. My ally still lies wounded.

recipes.label: Flesh and Steel
recipes.startdescription: Grail to restore and revitalise; Forge to cauterize and reinforce.

recipes.label: Call upon the Red Grail to enrich the blood and the flesh
recipes.startdescription: The 'patient' must usually be reassured before my prisoner goes to work. It is rare that any measure of reassurance is ever actually achieved, but I am working on a strict schedule. The injury will be healed, and that is all that matters.
recipes.description: There is blood, there is savour, there is ceremony. And the flesh knits back together like it was never wounded at all - not even a scar remains.

recipes.label: Call upon the Red Grail to enrich the blood and the flesh
Call upon the Red Grail to enrich the blood and the flesh
recipes.startdescription: I have a guard on watch as my wounds are ministered to. And for good measure, I have a firearm of my own pointed at the prisoner. This should be over quickly, and without trouble. If there's trouble, it will end all the quicker.
recipes.description: There is blood, there is savour, there is ceremony. And then - done. The flesh knits back together like it was never wounded at all.

recipes.label: Provide medical attention to a wounded ally?
recipes.startdescription:
This will take a little more than morphine, stitches, and saws.

[Provide Ally Engineers to complete the healing of this Ally.]
recipes.description: I could not muster the material. My ally still lies wounded.

recipes.label: Flesh and Steel
recipes.startdescription: The medics and the engineers both seem a little out of their depth, but they get on with the work sufficiently enough. My ally will surely stand again.

recipes.label: Provide medical attention to a wounded ally
recipes.startdescription: Morphine and stitches. Saws, if necessary.
recipes.description: And done. They'll live to fight another day.

recipes.label: Provide medical attention to a wounded ally
Send scouts to learn the measure of the land
recipes.startdescription:
The broad movements of the sky and the air can threaten the unprepared, but my scouts can devise a way to turn even this to our advantage.

[This will convert a Hindrance into a useful Opportunity.]
recipes.description: There is a way to turn everything into a tool - a weapon.

recipes.label: Order repairs on damaged machinery
recipes.startdescription: Mending steel isn't always simpler than mending flesh, but with the proper tools it is a job like any other.
recipes.description: And done. These engines of war are returned to fighting order.

recipes.label: Order repairs on damaged infrastructure
recipes.startdescription: I have decided that this facility must be operational again, and soon. The engineers will have their work cut out for them. Wipe the hands and ready the tools - no way to begin but to start.
recipes.description: And done. The men will appreciate having this ready for use again.

recipes.label: Order the construction of new lodgings for personnel
recipes.startdescription:
We can only have so many men sleeping out in the cold before half our contingent is dying from exposure. The construction of a new personnel space will help allay that problem.

[This will create a new Barracks for your Allies, but will permanently expend the Engineers used.]
recipes.description: And done. The structure stands.

recipes.label: Seek medical attention at a field hospital
recipes.startdescription:
Here, we have the necessary instruments and supplies to treat our wounded.

[Place any Wounded Allies here to treat their injuries. You can also put Wounds of your own here to heal them.]
recipes.description: What damage the doctors could remedy has been dealt with. Time will carry the recovery the rest of the way, but we might naturally be short on that during a war. Can't be helped.

recipes.label: Seek medical attention at a field hospital
recipes.startdescription:
Here, we have the necessary instruments and supplies to treat our wounded.

[Place any Wounded Allies here to treat their injuries. You can also put Wounds of your own here to heal them.]
recipes.description: What damage the doctors could remedy has been dealt with. Time will carry the recovery the rest of the way, but we might naturally be short on that during a war. Can't be helped.

recipes.label: Nowhere to Go
recipes.startdescription:
Reassign my Allies? To what other contingent? We are the only ones here.

[You cannot call abandon any Allies while here.]

recipes.label: Release my creation from its service
recipes.startdescription: Loyalty is a chain, and choice is freedom's shadow. What will it do, I wonder, without a master? What could it become?
recipes.description: My creation gives me one last, inscrutable look. Then it turns, and lopes away into the countryside.

recipes.label: Reassign an Ally
recipes.startdescription: I could cut down on the size of my contingent by assigning this Ally elsewhere. Perhaps we must travel lighter. Perhaps we must run.
recipes.description: Done.

recipes.label: Beyond the Charting of Men
recipes.startdescription:
Old powers of the moon and sea keep the lake hidden from the world at large. Even if we had the means to contact our allies on the outside, no-one would be able to hear our plea.

[You cannot call for Ally reinforcements while here.]

recipes.label: No More?
recipes.startdescription:
It would be unwise - and untenable - to summon more allies to our position, and have no place prepared to quarter them.

[When your Force Size equals or exceeds total Space, you will be unable to call for ally reinforcements.]

recipes.label: Request ally reinforcements
recipes.startdescription: Send word over wire and wave. If we need more manpower, this is the way to ask for it.

recipes.label: Send an ally to procure reinforcements
recipes.startdescription:
With our communications non-operational, radio and telegram are no longer viable options for us. If we need reinforcements, someone must make the long trek to the next allied position, and then return again.

[Without a Communications Tower, asking for reinforcements will take much longer.]

recipes.label: Awaiting Reinforcements...
recipes.startdescription: Time does what it usually does, and passes. With luck, fresh allies are already en route.

recipes.label: Awaiting Reinforcements...
recipes.startdescription: Time does what it usually does, and passes. I can only hope that our messenger has gone unharried by the enemy or by the elements.

recipes.label: Arrived!
recipes.startdescription: More men to the cause; more meat to the slaughter.

recipes.label: Arrived!
recipes.startdescription: More men to the cause; more meat to the slaughter.

recipes.label: Seize a church for personnel space
recipes.startdescription: There will be some protest from the priest, and from members of the congregation. Introduce anyone who protests too much to the end of a rifle.
recipes.description: Makeshift beds have been laid across the halls and the altar; icons have been torn down and resigned to kindling. And if any of the men feel they might need forgiveness, they can ask for it right here. Convenient.

recipes.label: Visit a local church to reflect
recipes.startdescription: I am not sure I still quite believe in God, but church's doors are open, and my soul feels heavy. Perhaps a moment here could do me some good. Perhaps.
recipes.description: With a deep breath, I stand up to leave. Too much time alone with one's own mind can make a man sick.

recipes.label: Seize a local farm for personnel space
recipes.startdescription: Generous plots of land. There is space to spare here. The farmers might not be so generous, though, so we will convince him with our words and our smiles and our rifles.
recipes.description: And so we have come to an understanding. The farmer shakes my hand, silent.

recipes.label: Demand supplies from a local farm
recipes.startdescription: Fighting men must have enough to eat and drink if they are to remain in fighting condition. A forceful visit to the local farm might help us in that matter.
recipes.description: The farmers reluctantly give, and we humbly accept. This will carry us through the coming weeks for a little.

recipes.label: Contempt and Dissidence
recipes.startdescription: Our rough dealings with the locals have made us some new enemies: a handful of vengeful young boys and bitter old men have decided they will not brook our abuse any longer. They're no soldiers, but the element of surprise - and enough hatred - can compensate for what these partisans lack in training.
recipes.description: We can round up and execute what dissenters we can, but the damage is done.

recipes.label: I am wounded!
recipes.startdescription: This body is mortal, and the trials of war will see it destroyed if I am careless -

recipes.label: I am wounded!
recipes.startdescription: This body is mortal, and the trials of war will see it destroyed if I am careless -

recipes.label: I am wounded!
recipes.startdescription: This body is mortal, and the trials of war will see it destroyed if I am careless -

recipes.startdescription: This body is mortal, and the trials of war will see it destroyed if I am careless -

recipes.startdescription: This body is mortal, and the trials of war will see it destroyed if I am careless -

recipes.startdescription: This body is mortal, and the trials of war will see it destroyed if I am careless -

recipes.label: I am wounded!
recipes.startdescription: This body is mortal, and the trials of war will see it destroyed if I am careless -

recipes.label: I am wounded!
recipes.startdescription: This body is mortal, and the trials of war will see it destroyed if I am careless -

recipes.label: Strife!
recipes.startdescription: Battle begets battle. The Corrivality seethes and actuates anew, and so struggle will endure.

recipes.label: Cracks in the Soul
recipes.startdescription: The rest of the world will not believe us. They will not believe us when we tell them what things we have seen and what horrors we have suffered -

recipes.label: Make Pilgrimage to an Iron Shrine
recipes.startdescription:
My understanding of the Colonel's arts has reached its mortal limits. Perhaps immortal knowledge is what I need, now.

[This will wound you.]
recipes.description: I close my eyes. In the shadows, I hear the uneven shuffling of the Name, Antigonus Cyclopes, and the keen hissing of the sword he carries on his hip. 'Heed me, killer of men,' he rasps in his voice of sulphur and steel. 'Here is a weapon, and here is its nature.'

recipes.label: Make Pilgrimage to an Iron Shrine
recipes.startdescription:
The Colonel's shrines sometimes smell of gunpowder, and sometimes of snow. Meditation here will improve my understanding of the techniques the Colonel's Names teach.

[This will wound you.]
recipes.description: In the space beneath the altar, I find a gift.

recipes.label: Make Pilgrimage to an Iron Shrine
recipes.startdescription:
The Colonel's shrines sometimes smell of gunpowder, and sometimes of snow. Meditation here will improve my understanding of the techniques the Colonel's Names teach.

[This will wound you.]
recipes.description: My bones creak. My hearing seems sharper.

recipes.label: Present my Scars at an Iron Shrine
recipes.startdescription: The Colonel and his Names honour the sufferings of the soldiery. My body is testament to my suffering, and I may present it here to be sharpened under the old traditions of war.
recipes.description: Through service, suffering; through suffering, experience; through experience, victory. My strengths are scars and my scars are absolute.

recipes.label: Seek Counsel at an Iron Shrine
recipes.startdescription: If the true nature of a Contemplation eludes me, I could come to the shrine in search of truth. The Colonel's Names may offer me counsel on how to join their ranks - if I bring an appropriate offering.
recipes.description: The shrine is still. No Name has noticed me.

recipes.label: A Revelation in Iron
recipes.startdescription: The air in the shrine grows colder. My vision flickers, and soon I see only black. Something has come.
recipes.description: I can hear the uneven footsteps of Antigonus Cyclopes, Name of the Colonel, as he crosses the threshold to instruct me. 'Killer of men,' he rasps. 'Listen now - here is the shape of truth.'

recipes.label: A Walk with Wolves
recipes.startdescription: In their greys and blacks they lope cautiously through the snow, watching me. I shouldn't get too close.
recipes.description: The wolves are there, and then they are not.

recipes.label: Thrown to the Wolves
recipes.startdescription: My ally won't like this. But then, who likes getting ripped apart by a pack of wolves?
recipes.description: What remains of my ally is an ugly, maimed redness. The wolves withdraw to the trees, but still I see the brightness of their eyes and the dripping in their fangs. I smell blood, or something like blood.

recipes.label: Thrown to the Wolves
recipes.startdescription: My ally won't like this. But then, who likes getting ripped apart by a pack of wolves?
recipes.description: What remains of my ally is an ugly, maimed redness. The wolves withdraw to the trees, but still I see the brightness of their eyes and the dripping in their fangs. I smell blood, or something like blood.

recipes.label: The Wolf's Tale
recipes.startdescription: One long, sorrowful howl rises over the voice of the wind, and I see a white wolf approaching me. The other wolves give this one a wide berth.
recipes.description: Wolves do not have words. But a voice that sounded like winter related to me the story of a centuries-old enmity, and an unlikely tragedy that ended it.

recipes.label: The Wolf's Tale
recipes.startdescription: One long, sorrowful howl rises over the voice of the wind, and I see a white wolf approaching me. The other wolves give this one a wide berth.
recipes.description: Wolves do not have words. But a voice that sounded like winter related to me the story of a centuries-old enmity, and an unlikely tragedy that ended it.

recipes.label: Listen to the chatter of the birds?
recipes.startdescription: I have a spare moment. What may I hear?
recipes.description: Nothing consequential, I suppose.

recipes.label: The Songs of Water and Mist
recipes.startdescription: The clicking and keening of the birds overhead begins to sound like something else entirely. In tinny voices of flute-breeze and wood-children, the birds exchange secrets and gossip. 'The lake,' a chorus of them sing. 'The lake...'
recipes.description: The birds have seen it. Now I have, too.

recipes.label: The Path to the Ragged Sword?
recipes.startdescription: I've heard enough. Now the gossiping of the birds has betrayed the location of the sword, and a path to what I seek comes clear...
recipes.description: We may proceed.

recipes.label: The Name of the Lake
recipes.startdescription: The lake's surface is as still and shining as a mirror, and the moon reflected upon it is a perfect twin. Without the slightest of ripples, a pale woman rises from the depths of the lake, cradling a jagged iron weapon in her arms like a mother would cradle a child. Her eyes are closed - but still her head turns to judge me. Is it disdain in expression? Or melancholy?
recipes.description: 'Killer of men,' the woman whispers, her lips yet motionless. 'Scarce a second has passed since I was reunited with my treasure, and now you come to claim it from me. Claim it, then - so many times has the sword passed from Pearl to Scar, and back again. This is but one turn of exchange. But mark me, killer of men - scarce another second will pass before that weapon is returned to the lake.' She extends the sword in her arms to me.

recipes.label: Search for Something Unseen
recipes.startdescription: The one called Exile talked about Medusa, once. 'Start with a bow, and make sure you're staring at the pavement when you do. Let her speak first, even though she cannot speak.' they told me. 'And don't look at her face. Easier if you're blind, naturally.' I trust my friend's advice - but a Ligeian is a Ligeian. I think I might be afraid.
recipes.description: Nothing. The night yet holds its breath. If the Ligeian Medusa is here, she has elected not to be found. My heart slows. Perhaps it is good I did not meet her tonight.

recipes.label: An Ancient Agreement
recipes.startdescription: It begins to rain, softly. I carry the limestone icon with both hands across my chest, clasping its clumsy weight like a shield. 'What is not seen?' I press the slab harder to my chest. 'A promise.' Behind me, I hear something slither out onto the empty street.
recipes.description:
There is an absent hour in my memory. I do not remember the conversation I had with the Ligeian (if we indeed had one), but I remember that she was bitter. Angry, maybe. But if she was angry, why am I still alive? I look again at the slab's reverse side, and see that where there were five scores in the stone, there are now six.

[Medusa and her Forest Key will find you at Stalingrad, if and when the time comes.]

recipes.label: Meeting the Continental
recipes.startdescription: I find the scarred woman cleaning her revolver as she sits atop the corpse of the labhite. 'Well fought, soldier,' she says to me, looking up as I approach. 'To what do I owe the assistance?'
recipes.description: The woman blinks at me, nonplussed. I think I should say something.

recipes.label: Regarding the Warmaker...
recipes.startdescription: The Continental cracks a small smile when I mention the trouble the Warmaker has been giving me. 'It's very much like him to take the long way around. Probably admiring the scenery,' she mutters. 'And without me close by, he'll rush on to fight the next strongest thing he can find. Fortunately for you, we can iron all that out now.'
recipes.description: 'I will help you draw him here. When he arrives, leave the rest in my hands.'

recipes.label: A Challenge in the Ancient Mode
recipes.startdescription: I explain the duty the Exile charged me with, and the Continental becomes intrigued. 'Ah. You are the one Duffoure's child has been speaking of. Not even thirty years immortal, and they're already advising on who ought to be Named and who shouldn't,' she muses. 'Though if you're considering musvashir, I suppose you must be serious. Perhaps Duffoure's child has chosen well.'
recipes.description: 'We must put things in order before I can formally relay your challenge to my enemy. These proceedings require each participant recruit the services of a delegate, so that the challenged and the challenger may communicate without coming face-to-face. Your chosen delegate - your second - must be someone of note. Naturally, I will be my enemy's second. Find a suitable associate to serve as yours, and matters can proceed.'

recipes.label: Offer an Iron Spintria at the altar
recipes.startdescription: The striges, minor Names of battle, often roost unseen at the shrines of the Edge Hours. Perhaps I can draw one's attention - and assistance - with this token of iron. And providing it a meal couldn't hurt, either.
recipes.description: The shrine is still. Nothing stirs in the darkness.

recipes.label: A Toll, Paid
recipes.startdescription: A flapping sound in the shadows above me - a Many-Winged One clambers down towards the altar to receive my offering, talons clicking against the stone. It eats its fill with as much grace as it might manage. When it is done, it bids me to approach with a whisper: 'Killer of men - what is it you would ask?' I hold out the letter I have written for my friend.
recipes.description: The strix chitters to itself, and snatches the letter from me with its taloned hand. Without another word, it flies off into the shadows.

recipes.label: My Message is in Transit...
recipes.startdescription: The many-winged messenger I have sent will convey my message to the Exile - in due time. Then my friend will have to write a reply (with what I hope is an agreement to represent me), and again the messenger must fly. All I can be now is patient.

recipes.label: My Friend's Message is in Transit...
recipes.startdescription: Now the many-winged messenger will carry my friend's letter to the Continental. She will read it, and then she will reply with a confirmation for my duel with the Warmaker. Again, all I can be now is patient.

recipes.label: A Letter!
recipes.startdescription: When it is stillest night, a Many-Winged One finds me alone on the camp perimeter. It offers me a crisp, pale envelope in one of its taloned hands -

recipes.label: A Letter!
recipes.startdescription: When it is stillest night, a Many-Winged One finds me alone on the camp perimeter. It offers me a crisp, pale envelope in one of its taloned hands -

recipes.label: The Appointed Time Approaches...
recipes.startdescription: Things are in motion now. I should prepare myself. When the time comes, I must be in the countryside, alone and punctual. There will be consequences if I fail to do this.

recipes.label: The Appointed Time Approaches...
recipes.startdescription: Things are in motion now. When the time comes, I must be in the countryside, alone and punctual. There will be consequences if I fail to do this.

recipes.label: Combatants, Assembling
recipes.startdescription: The countryside sprawls yawning before me. I have come according to the rules of the old sacrament, armed and armoured with nothing but my weapons and my skills. Here, I await the arrival of my opponent.
recipes.description: From the north, an approaching pair of silhouettes becomes visible in the distance. From the south, a lone figure marches steadily closer.

recipes.label: PUNISHMENT
recipes.startdescription: I have failed to appear alone in the appointed place at the appointed time. In so doing, I have violated the holiness of one of war's most revered sacraments. The Edge Hours and their Names will not tolerate this -

recipes.label: PUNISHMENT
recipes.startdescription: I have failed to appear alone in the appointed place at the appointed time. In so doing, I have violated the holiness of one of war's most revered sacraments. The Edge Hours and their Names will not tolerate this -

recipes.label: I Cannot Leave
recipes.startdescription: I am obligated to stand my ground by the ancient rules of musvashir, or I tempt dishonour and obliteration. Until I am either raised victorious over my opponent or struck down defeated, I will remain here.

recipes.label: I Cannot Leave
recipes.startdescription: I am obligated to stand my ground by the ancient rules of musvashir, or I tempt dishonour and obliteration. Until I am either raised victorious over my opponent or, by their hand, struck down defeated, I will remain here.

recipes.label: Assemble a sacred weapon of the Colonel
recipes.startdescription: The Histids served the Colonel when Mycenae was yet young, and were among the first immortal-slayers instructed in his arts. The weapon I intend to fashion would be familiar to their kind.
recipes.description: The Histids taught the Tragulari, and the Tragulari were lost to History. But here and there, in times of war, their secrets resurface.

recipes.label: Call upon a fallen compatriot to fight once more
recipes.startdescription: My allies are dead. I cannot return them whole to this world; nothing can, I think. But I can speak to the part of them that remembers duty and discipline, and it will set again in the flesh like a spark igniting dry paper.
recipes.description: We will fight as comrades one last time.

recipes.label: Command fatigued allies to rally and rise again
recipes.startdescription: If there is even the slightest spark of fighting spirit in these men, I will fan it into a great and furious flame. If there is not, they will be compelled to fight regardless. I will not be disobeyed.
recipes.description: 'Forward. Only forward.'

recipes.label: The Earth Sleeps Not
recipes.startdescription: The world shakes. The earth's deep sleep is troubled -
